Topic.Title: Lets talk about Real Issues and Obama's Record

Message.Msg: Indeed, reality CAN be ugly, and Mitt has a long history of avoiding it, running from it, or retiring it retroactively. On every issue of substance, from health care to gun control to taxes to foreign policy to abortion and military service, Mitt has been for it, against it, and indifferent to it. Some of that ugly reality includes his 'varmint gun' NRA support after passing an assault weapons ban in Massachusetts; instituting a mandatory health insurance law in that state before attacking Obamacare at the national level; being pro-life, then pro-choice, then pro-life again, even as one of his Bain-funded companies, Stericycle, enabled him to profit from the disposal of aborted fetuses. He pays lip service to those in the military, yet never deigned to perform any service himself and seized upon every possible deferment to avoid doing so, including missionary work for the French. Now this childhood bully and adult panderer wants to abolish health care, avoid the gun control debate (though in fairness, Obama isn't going to initiate it either); double the defense budget; kill all family planning programs; retain tax cuts for the rich, slash social services, and kill Dodd-Frank (because the banks are trustworthy and have such a strong record of self-regulation?). The ship of state is obviously taking on water, and the captain appears confused and uncertain of his course of action. However, handing command of the ship over to a lunatic whose plan amounts to shooting holes in the bottom to let the water out seems ill-advised at best. ROTFLMAO at those who try to frame this election as "it's all about Obama". No, it's not! Fifty percent of it is about Romney, no matter how hard he tries to deny it.

Topic.Title: Lets talk about Real Issues and Obama's Record

Message.Msg: Why Bush was so bad at the end of his term... Some people aren't aware of all of this. Don't just skim over this, please read it slowly and let it sink in. If in doubt, check it out. Dates HAVE BEEN verified. The day the democrats took over was notJanuary 22nd 2009, it was actually January 3,2007... the day the Democrats took over the House of Representatives and the Senate, at the very start of the 110th Congress. The Democrat Party controlled a majority in both chambers for the first time since the end of the 103rd Congress in 1995. For those who are listening to the liberals propagating the fallacy that everything is "Bush's Fault", think about this: January 3rd, 2007 was the day the Democrats took over the Senate and the Congress. At the time: The DOW Jones closed at 12,621.77 The GDP for the previous quarter was 3.5% The Unemployment rate was 4.6% George Bush's Economic policies SET A RECORD of 52 STRAIGHT MONTHS of JOB GROWTH Remember the day... January 3rd, 2007 was the day that Barney Frank took over the House Financial Services Committee and Chris Dodd took over the Senate Banking Committee. The economic meltdown that happened 15 months later was in what part of the economy? BANKING AND FINANCIAL SERVICES! Unemployment... to this CRISIS by (among MANY other things) dumping 5-6 TRILLION Dollars of toxic loans on the economy from YOUR Fannie Mae and Fred die Mac FIASCOES! Bush asked Congress 17 TIMES to stop Fannie & Fred die - starting in 2001 because it was financially risky for the US economy. And who took the THIRD highest pay-off from Fannie Mae AND Fred die Mac? OBAMA And who fought against reform of Fannie and Fred die? OBAMA and the Democrat Congress So when someone tries to blame Bush.. REMEMBER JANUARY 3rd, 2007.... THE DAY THE DEMOCRATS TOOK OVER!" Budgets do not come from the White House. They come from Congress, and the party that controlled Congress since January 2007 is the Democrat Party. Furthermore, the Democrats controlled the budget process for 2008 & 2009 as well as 2010 & 2011. In that first year, they had to contend with George Bush, which caused them to compromise on spending, when Bush somewhat belatedly got tough on spending increases. For 2009 though, Nancy Pelosi & Harry Reid bypassed George Bush entirely, passing continuing resolutions to keep government running until Barack Obama could take office. At that time, they passed a massive omnibus spending bill to complete the 2009 budgets. And where was Barack Obama during this time? He was a member of that very Congress that passed all of these massive spending bills, and he signed the omnibus bill as President to complete 2009. If the Democrats inherited any deficit, it was the 2007 deficit, the last of the Republican budgets. That deficit was the lowest in five years, and the fourth straight decline in deficit spending. After that, Democrats in Congress took control of spending, and that includes Barack Obama, who voted for the budgets. If Obama inherited anything, he inherited it from himself. In a nutshell, what Obama is saying is "I inherited a deficit that I voted for and then I voted to expand that deficit four-fold since January 20th." There is no way this will be widely publicized unless each of us sends it on! -- PLEASE.... Vote For The AMERICAN!!

Message.Title: ANYBODY IS WATCHING IN AMRN ???
Message.Msg: Scenario 1) FDA approval with NCE. I would expect shares to open at $21-23. Sell half and hold the rest. NCE would likely lead to an eventual buyout by a large pharmaceutical company. Scenario 2) FDA approval; without NCE. I would expect shares to open at $18-20. Traders should be selling all shares immediately. I would likely initiate a short position on the open, expecting shares to possibly be down on the day by the close. Scenario 3) FDA approval, no decision on NCE. I would expect shares to open $19-21. Trader will likely sell all their shares and step to the sidelines. Shares will likely drift lower, but still be up on the day !!!

Message.Title: So, what exactly did Draghi say?. You can't even get the quote from mass media:
Message.Msg: Did he say he would do what it takes to save the Euro or Euro zone? Yahoo says Euro, Bloomberg says Euro zone. Those are 2 different things. Looks like instead of giving money to banks and have them buy government bonds (which he has done and it failed), he would force the banks to buy on their own. That makes sense, except that: would banks buy with their own money? I doubt it. So, essentially, what it means is: no more bailouts for Europe, which means governments won't be able to help banks and banks won't be able to help governments. That is what Germany wants. If Spain and Greece stay, Euro won't survive. Now, they'll have to go. I was tempted to open a short position on the DOW today, but I will wait until July 31. The downfall will be quick, once the "good" Draghi news sinks in...

Topic.Title: Foreclosure

Message.Msg: BOA is absolutely discusting, I fell behind and went to my local branch with a bank check for 35k; they refused to take it. Instead they rejected my application for a loan-mod and now they want me to pay 20K up front and then 9k a month for 6 months. The are knowingly contributing to the problem. They got bailed out and now crap on their clients who need help.

Topic.Title: Foreclosure

Message.Msg: oh yeah - We have lived in our property for 110 months. I requested a complete payment history on our account from BAC, based on their saying we were behind by 2 months. You know how many payments their own comprehensive statement of all our payments showed we have made ? 110. Go figure. And when you actually want to talk with someone about it - you can't. You have to leave a message and they say they will call you back in 24hrs. or less. And guess what? they don't!

Topic.Title: Foreclosure

Message.Msg: How many payments did you miss?

Message.Title: MARKET MAKERS AND HEDGIES look as to hold hostage the Senators, Congressmen, and general public that own BAC common stock shares.
Message.Msg: Best way to fix this massive shorting, selling, instability production is to tie up the float. Currently there are an astronomically high number of shorts or others that bought shares when they were much lower 3 dollars, etc.. If the market makers snatched up the great majority of those shares in 2008 or 2009 then they hold our senators, congressmen, citizens, general BAC investors hostage to their whimsical trading strategies. We will continue to suffer if owning BAC shares bought at 15 dollars for the 2009 secondary shares and the 10 dollar secondary of ?2008? and other problems. It is imperative that Brian Moynihan figure a way to get those shares out of their hands and into people who are stronger holders if we are to see 15 dollars again soon. DYODD JMHO
